org.dockbox.selene.persistence.configurate

Class DefaultConfigurateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dockbox.selene.persistence.DefaultAbstractFileManager
      • org.dockbox.selene.persistence.configurate.DefaultConfigurateManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InjectableType, FileManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpongeConfigurateManager

    public abstract class DefaultConfigurateManager
extends DefaultAbstractFileManager
    Implementation of FileManager containing dynamic mapping to appropriate ConfigurationLoaders based on the given FileType by the implementation of this type. Supporting FileType.YAML, FileType.JSON, FileType.XML, FileType.MOD_CONFIG, and FileType.CONFIG file types.

    Automatically generates, and checks the presence of, files in their directories. For both custom file locations and TypedOwner.id() based.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        @NotNull
public <T> @NotNull Exceptional<T> read(@NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.nio.file.Path file,
                                                  @NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Get the content of a file, and map the given values to a generic type T. The exact file is completely dynamic, though it is usually encouraged to use FileManager.getDataFile(org.dockbox.selene.api.domain.TypedOwner) or FileManager.getConfigFile(java.lang.Class<?>) to obtain appropriate files.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the type to map to
        Parameters:
        file - The file to read the content of
        type - The exact type to map to
        Returns:
        A Exceptional instance holding either the mapping T instance, or a Throwable

      • write

        @NotNull
public <T> @NotNull Exceptional<java.lang.Boolean> write(@NotNull
                                                                   @NotNull java.nio.file.Path file,
                                                                   @NotNull
                                                                   T content)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Write a generic type T to a given file. The exact file is completely dynamic, though it is usually encouraged to use FileManager.getDataFile(org.dockbox.selene.api.domain.TypedOwner) or FileManager.getConfigFile(java.lang.Class<?>) to obtain appropriate files.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the content
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write the content of
        content - The content to write
        Returns:
        A Exceptional instance holding a Boolean indicating the success status of the write process, or a Throwable. If a Throwable is present, the Boolean value should be false.
